    • Method Detail

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger()

        Returns an anonymous logger instance.

        It is recommended to use getLogger(String), to get the a logger with a name.

        Returns:
        an instance of Logger without a name.
        Since:
        09/04/2017

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a Logger instance.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the logger.
        Returns:
        A Logger instance with the name passed to this method.

      • addLogFile

        public void addLogFile(java.io.File log)

        Sets the file to which the Logger will write to.

        If one has already been set, it will be overridden.

        Do not enter something which is null to remove the file. Use removeLogFile() instead!

        Parameters:
        log - The file to log to.
        Since:
        09/04/2017

      • removeLogFile

        public void removeLogFile()

        Removes the log File and disabled logging, in case it was enabled.

        Since:
        09/04/2017

      • setLogToFile

        public void setLogToFile(boolean logToFile)
                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException

        Enables or disabled logging to file.

        Parameters:
        logToFile - true if you wish to enable file logging, false if you want to disable it.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If you haven't added a file with addLogFile(File) before.
        Since:
        09/04/2017

      • getFileLog

        public java.io.File getFileLog()

        Returns the file which the logger is writing to.

        Returns:
        The file. null if not set.
        Since:
        09/04/2017

      • log

        public void log(java.lang.Object info)

        Logs an entry to the console with the default LogLevel.

        Parameters:
        info - The Object whose String representation should be logged to the console.
        Since:
        09/04/2017

      • log

        public void log(LogLevel level,
                java.lang.Object info)

        Logs an entry to the console with the specified LogLevel

        Parameters:
        level - The logging LogLevel.
        info - The Object whose String representation should be logged to the console.
        Since:
        09/04/2017

      • logGlobal

        public void logGlobal(java.lang.Object info)

        Logs an entry to the console with the default LogLevel.

        The full date and time as well as timezone will be shown.

        Parameters:
        info - The Object whose String representation should be logged to the console.
        Since:
        09/04/2017

      • logGlobal

        public void logGlobal(LogLevel level,

        The full date and time as well as timezone will be shown.

        Parameters:

        09/04/2017
